svcproc.title: HEATER/AC THERMOSTAT TEMPERATURE CONTROLS
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 2 for the following discussion. There is an air duct connecting the Blendaire unit to the sleeper. A blower motor in the sleeper draws air from the blendaire unit. The optional sleeper heater/A.C. controls include a three-speed blower switch and a thermostat. The thermostat allows the sleeper occupant to select a suitable temperature level, then the controls automatically regulate the damper door (part of the sleeper blower motor assembly) allowing more or less heated/cooled air to be drawn into the sleeper to maintain the preset temperature level. The manually selected blower speed and thermostatically controlled damper door, determine how much cooled or heated air is brought into the sleeper from the cab Blendaire system.
